label: 詹糖
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Chan-t'ang (Ch.).  A South China tree said to resemble the sourpeel tangerine (Citrus deliciosa).  The scent was supposed to suggest plum blossoms, and it was therefore particularly appropriate for use in the spring.  Used as an ingredient for baika (plum-blossom incense). (p. 652) [梅香]
